[looking at the Marauder's Map for the first time] Hang on. This is Hogwarts. And that... no. Is that really...?
[irritated] My dad didn't strut. And nor do I. Now if you don't mind, I would appreciate it if you would lower your wand.
"Messrs. Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot and Prongs... offer their compliments to Professor Snape and..."
[amused] "...and request that he keep his abnormally large nose out of other people's business."
No. Pettigrew's dead. [to Sirius] You killed him!
All they could find left of Pettigrew was his...
Show me. [Sirius tries to take the rat from Ron, but Ron holds onto it] Give it to him, Ron.
I know what he is. But we'll take him up to the castle.
Get off! I said we'll take you to the castle. After that, the dementors can have you.
Well, I just didn't think my dad would've wanted his two best friends to become killers. Besides, dead the truth dies with him. Alive, you're free.
I don't know. Honestly Ron, how can somebody be in two places at once?
(to Sirius) I know why! You betrayed my parents! You're the reason they're dead!
[To Ron] I didn't put my name in that cup. I don't want eternal glory. I just want to be... Look. I don't know what happened tonight and I don't know why. It just did. Okay?
[To Ron] You're a right foul git, you that?
[To Draco] I don't give a damn what your father thinks, Malfoy! He's vile, and cruel... and you're just pathetic.
[On attempting to ask girls out] Why do they have to travel in packs? And how are you supposed to get one alone long enough to ask them?
He's back! He's back! Voldemort's back! Cedric, he asked me to bring his body back. I couldn't leave him... not there!
It was you from the beginning. You put my name in the Goblet of Fire. You bewitched Krum but...
I-I don't know. I haven't really thought about it. [looks at the quill, which is writing on its own]
[looks at the quill's notes] Hey! My eyes aren't "glistening with the ghosts of my past"!
No. Voldemort was giving him a job to do. Something important.
He wanted... me. I don't know why, but he was gonna use this man to get to me. But, I mean, it was only a dream, right?
Do you think one of them put my name in the goblet?
I'm not ready for this, Sirius.
Is that right? Well... You can tell him... Wait... What?
[enraged] I don't give a damn what your father thinks, Malfoy! He's vile, and cruel... and you're just pathetic.
Caught on, have you? Took you long enough.
[sarcastic] Brilliant. That makes me feel loads better.
Hagrid warned me about the dragons.
[confused] ...Who? Who could possibly figure that out? That's completely mental.
[To Fred and George]] Oi! [They lean in to him] You're never gonna let him forget this, are you?
Well, I expect yours are more... traditional—
[Looking at Cho] Yeah, she does... Wha– [Turns around and sees Hermione coming down the stairs. Noticing how beautiful she really looks, he smiles gently, agreeing with Parvati]
I suppose Viktor's already figured it out.
[Crying over Cedric's body] He's back! He's back! Voldemort's back! Cedric, he asked me to bring his body back. I couldn't leave him... not there!
It was you from the beginning! You put my name into the Goblet of Fire! You bewitched Krum! But--

[Addressing Dumbledore's Army] Working hard is important. But there is something that matters even more, believing in yourself. Think of it this way; every great wizard in history has started out as nothing more than what we are now: students. If they can do it, why not us?
[after Dumbledore announced Umbridge the new Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher, whispering to Hermione] She was at my hearing. She works for Fudge.
Where are we going? The letter said I had been expelled from Hogwarts.
I don't understand, what's the Ministry of Magic got against me?
But that's insane. No one in their right mind could believe that Dumbledore--
Good! I want to join! If Voldemort's raising an army, then I want to fight!
I was only doing it because of the Dementors!
I'm not lying! There were two of them and if I hadn't--
[sees a strange reptilian-like thestrals] What is it?
[increasingly angry] Oh, well, I guess you should read the Prophet then, like your stupid mother, it'll tell you everything you need to know!
I'll have a go at anyone that calls me a liar!
So why can't the others see them?
So... you've known someone who's died?
Thanks. It seems you're about the only ones that do.
Well, what use is that? If we're gonna be attacked, it won't be risk-free.
And how’s theory supposed to prepare us for what's out there?
[sarcastically] Oh, I don't know, maybe Lord Voldemort!
It's not a lie! I saw him! I fought him!
So according to you Cedric Diggory dropped dead of his own accord.
[angrily] It was murder! Voldemort killed him! You must know!
No. Dumbledore's got enough on his mind right now. Anyway, I don't want to give Umbridge the satisfaction.
Yeah, well, I haven't got any of those, have I, Ron?
No, it's not. Hermione, whatever this, it's not simple. You don't understand.
First we need to find a place to practice where Umbridge won't find out.
It's brilliant! It's like Hogwarts wants us to fight back.

I'm not going to talk about Cedric, so if that's why you're here you might as well clear out now. [aside to Hermione] C'mon, Hermione, let's go. They're just here because they think I'm some sort of freak.
Wait... look, it all sounds great when you say it like that. But the truth is most of that was just luck. I didn't know what I was doing half the time, I nearly always had help...

No, Hermione, I'm not! Facing this stuff in real life is not like school. In school, if you make a mistake you can just try again tomorrow. But out there, when you're a second away from being murdered or watching a friend die right before your eyes... you don't know what that's like.
Are you alright? I heard Umbridge gave you a rough time the other day.
Cedric, Cedric did know this stuff. He was really good. It's just, Voldemort was better.
Wet. Well, she was sort of... crying.
Neither, I--It was like I--Professor, will you please just tell me what's happening?
[enraged] LOOK AT ME! [Dumbledore finally faces Harry] What's happening to me?
You mean if he knows about it then, he'll be able to read my mind?

[to Sirius] This connection between me and Voldemort, what if the reason for it is that I'm becoming more like him? [starts to choke up; fighting back tears] I just feel so... angry, all the time. And what if after everything I've been through, something's gone wrong inside me. What if I'm becoming bad?
We're gonna make them proud, Neville. That's a promise.
No, professor! He had nothing to do with it, it was me!

Yeah, but I agreed. I tried so hard to help, and all it's done is made things worse. Anyway, it doesn't matter anymore, because I don't want to play anymore. All it does is make you care too much - The more you care, the more you have to lose. Maybe, it's just best to...
Don't say a word against my father.
[heavy panting] We've been at it for hours. If I could just rest!
My father was a great man!
[to Ron and Hermione] Alert the Order if you can.
[to Snape; desperately] He's got Padfoot. He's got Padfoot at the place where it's hidden.
I'm sorry, Professor. But I must not tell lies.
Look, it's not that I don't appreciate everything you've done, all of you. But, I've got you into enough trouble as it is.
So, how are we going to get to London?
You do anything to us and I'll break it.
Why did Voldemort need me to come and get this?
Guess I can wait a little longer. NOW!
[While being possessed by Voldemort] You... you've lost, old man!
You're the weak one. And you'll never know love, or friendship. And I feel sorry for you.
No you don't. It's my fault.
How come you're not at the feast?
Are you sure you don't want any help looking?
I've been thinking about something Dumbledore said to me.
That even though we got a fight ahead of us, we've got one thing that Voldemort doesn't have.
[after Dumbledore asks him if he has feelings for Hermione] Oh no, no, no, I mean she's brilliant, but we're friends.
I've got a really good feeling about Hagrid's. I feel it's... it's the place to be tonight!
[After witnessing Dumbledore's murder] Snape! He trusted you!
No one, bit of a tosser really.
Actually, sir, after all these years, I just sorta go with it.
Sorry I made you miss the carriages by the way, Luna.
Oh, I am your friend, Luna.
Um... have you fixed a nose before?
...Okay, yeah, sure, give it a go.
Well you know... she has nice... skin.
Well, no, I'm just saying it could be a contributing factor.
I-I've never really thought about it. But I suppose, yeah. Very nice. [long pause] ...I think I'll be going to sleep now.
Did Voldemort ever make the shelf, sir? [Slughorn freezes] You knew him, didn't you, sir? Tom Riddle? You were his teacher.
What was he like? [no response] I'm sorry, sir. Forgive me. He killed my parents.
I know. I suppose I could've just used a Confundus Charm.
But I am the Chosen One. [Hermione hits on the head with a rolled up newspaper.] Sorry, um, kidding.
I think she just went to powder her nose.
Sir, I really think I should rejoin the party. My date...
[To Madam Pomfrey as she puts something on Ron's bedside table] Thank you.
Oh, sorry, sir, I should've announced myself. Cleared my throat. Coughed. You probably feared I was Professor Sprout!
Oh, well, just the general behavior, sir - the sneaking around, jumping when you saw me... Are those tentacular leaves, sir? They're very valuable, aren't they?
Personally, these plants always kind of freak me out.

I'm going to tell you something - something others have only guessed at. It's true. I am the Chosen One, only I can destroy him, but in order to do so, I need to know what Tom Riddle asked you all those years ago in your office, and I need to know what you told him. Be brave, sir. Be brave like my mother. Otherwise you disgrace her. Otherwise she died for nothing. Otherwise the bowl will remain empty, forever.
Incarcerous! [Snape blocks the spell] Fight back! You coward, fight back!
No. No, he was lowering his wand. In the end, it was Snape. It was always Snape. I did nothing. [Harry gives the locket to Hermione] It's fake. Open it.
Don't know. But whoever they are, they have the real Horcrux. It means it was all a waste. All of it.
I'm not coming back, Hermione. I've got to finish whatever Dumbledore started. And I don't know where that'll lead me, but I'll let you and Ron know where I am... when I can.
Just do me a favor. When I’m around, keep the snogging to a minimum, please.
Funny, he says the same thing about you.
[chuckles] You’re brilliant. You’re both brilliant. I never realized how beautiful this place was.
[Referring to Voldemort] The longer we stay here, the stronger he gets.
I told you everything Dumbledore told me. And in case you haven't noticed, we have found a Horcrux already.
[last lines, about Dobby] I want to bury him. Properly, without magic.
Hedwig, I think. She was tryna protect me.
Maybe that's the best reason to have it. Because of everything that's going on.
[as Runcorn] She's gone down to the courtrooms, with Umbridge.
[as Runcorn] Ron, you don't have a wife.
[as Runcorn] You're lying, Dolores... [Umbridge looks shocked, and Hermione tenses up] And one mustn't tell lies. Stupefy!
Look, if you've got something to say, don't be shy. Spit it out.
I thought you knew what you signed up for!

Well then, I'm sorry, but I don't quite understand. What part of this isn't living up to your expectations? Did you think we were gonna be staying in a five-star hotel? Finding a Horcrux every other day? You thought you'd be back with your mum by Christmas?
I told you everything Dumbledore told me! And in case you haven't noticed, we have found a Horcrux already.
What, you think I'm not listening too? YOU THINK I DON'T KNOW HOW THIS FEELS?!
No... this is where I was born. I’m not returning as someone else.
Just keep talking about that little ball of light touching your heart, and she'll come 'round.
You're not still mad at him, are you?
But she’s bored! If I could only let outonly let out for an hour or two.
But I haven’t had any messages from any of my friends… not one… all summer.
I’ll be in my bedroom, making no noise and pretending that I don’t exist.
Not to be to be rude or anything, but this isn’t a great time for me to have a house elf in my bedroom.
Dobby, ssh! I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to offend you, or anything.
You can’t have met many decent wizards then.
Stop! Stop, Dobby. Please be quiet! Are you all right?
What terrible things? Who’s plotting them?
Ok– I- understand. You can’t- say.
Dobby! Dobby, put the lamp down.
Give me the lamp! Dobby stop!
Get in there, and keep quiet!
Yes, sir… See why I’ve got to go back? I don’t belong here. I belong in your world, at Hogwarts. It’s the only place I’ve got friends!
Well, I expect they’ve… been- hang on- how do you know my friends haven’t been writing to me?
I can’t. Hogwarts is my home!
Ron! Fred. George. What are you all doing here?
Oh, sorry sir. I’m Harry, sir, Harry Potter.
I’m fine, thank you. I- I was just…
I was lost, I— hang on. What were you doing down there, then?
Well, it’s great to see you, too!
I definitely need to remember that one.
Voldemort killed my parents. He was nothing more than a murderer.
Sorry. Lost- lost control of the trolley. Why can’t we get through?
The train leaves at exactly eleven o’clock. We’ve missed it!
Maybe we should just go and wait by the car.
Ron, I should tell you, most Muggles aren’t accustomed to seeing a flying car.
Well come on, then. Let’s go lower. We need to find the train.
Now all we need to do is catch up with the train.
I’m trying. Your hand’s all sweaty.
I think we found the train.
Up! Up! Ron! Mind that tree!
Be thankful it’s not your neck.

See you, Hedwig. So, a house elf shows up in my bedroom, we can’t get through the barrier to platform nine and three-quarters, we almost get killed by a tree… clearly someone doesn’t want me here this year.
Oh- Hi, Colin. Nice to meet you.
No, Colin! Get out of the way! Let’s take him to Hagrid’s.
Malfoy. He called Hermione, …um, well, I don’t- I don’t know exactly what it means.
I heard it first in Lockhart’s office. And then again just—
It’s moving. I think it’s going to kill.
Strange. I’ve never seen spiders act like that.
Oh, no… It’s Filch’s cat. It’s Mrs. Norris.
It’s not true sir, I swear. I never touched Mrs. Norris.
When I said I wasn’t hungry. We were heading back to the common room when we found Mrs. Norris.
Do you think I should have told them? Dumbledore and the others, I mean?
Well, if there really is a Chamber of Secrets, a-and it really has been opened, then that means---
Well, maybe Ron’s right, Hermione. I mean, look at his family. The whole lot of them have been in Slytherin for centuries.
Well, how long will it take to make?
A month? But, Hermione, if Malfoy is the Heir of Slytherin, he could attack half the Muggle-borns in the school by then.
No, I think my- I think my arm’s broken.
It was you… You stopped the barrier from letting Ron and me through.
You nearly got Ron and me expelled!
Your Bludger? You made that Bludger chase after me?
You’d better clear off before my bones come back, Dobby, or I might strangle you!
I don’t suppose you could tell me why you’re trying to kill me?
Why do you wear that thing Dobby?
Repeat itself? You mean this has happened before?
Dobby, stop it! Stop it! Stop, Dobby! Tell me, Dobby. When did this happen before? Who’s doing it now?
Sya- hassa- she. Sya- hasi- heth. Sya- hasi- heth.
I know. I mean, I accidentally set a python on my cousin Dudley at the zoo once. Uh, once! But, so what? I bet loads of people here can do it.
What’s bad? If I hadn’t told that snake not to attack Justin.
You were there! You heard me!
I spoke a different language? But- I didn’t realize I- how can I speak a language without knowing I can?
But I’m not… I can’t be.
I’ll see you back in the common room.
No! Mr. Filch! Y-you- you don’t understand!
I… I-I was- I was just wondering if you’d put me in the right house.
Professor! Sir, your bird- there was nothing I could do- he- he just caught fire!
You don’t think it was me, Professor?
Ron, maybe I should do it?
Hermione, come out. We’ve got loads to tell you!
She should be out of hospital in a few days, when she stops coughing up fur balls… What’s this?
Looks like Moaning Myrtle’s flooded the bathroom.
Why would I throw something at you?
But, who threw it at you, anyway?
Excuse me. Could you tell me what’s going on here? Are you Tom Riddle?
It was Hagrid. Hagrid opened the Chanter of Secrets fifty years ago.
The monster had killed somebody, Ron. What would any of us have done?
W- what’s that you’ve got, Hagrid?
And they found it. Tom Riddle’s diary is gone.
We’ve got to talk to Hagrid, Ron. I can’t believe it’s him, but if he did set the monster loose last time, he’ll know how to get inside the Chamber of Secrets, and that’s a start.
I think it’s time to get my Dad’s old cloak out again.
Look, we have to ask you something. Do you know who’s opened the Chamber of Secrets?
Look! Well, come on. Come on, Fang!
You heard what Hagrid said; ‘Follow the spiders.’
We’re friends of Hagrid’s. And you? Y- y-you’re Aragog aren’t you?
He’s in trouble. Up at the school, there have been attacks. They think it’s Hagrid. They think he opened the Chamber of Secrets, like before.
Shush. But if you’re not the monster, then- then what did kill that girl fifty years ago?
One, but it’s not powerful enough for all of them.
Don’t mention it. Get us out of here. Now! Come on! Come on! Move faster!
Go on! Go! Get us in the air.
We know one thing. Hagrid never opened the Chamber of Secrets. He was innocent.
Wish you were here Hermione. We need you… now, more than ever.
Ron, this is why Hermione was in the Library the day she was attacked. Come on!

‘Of the many fearsome beasts that roam our land, none is more deadly than the basilisk. Capable of living for hundreds of years, instant death awaits any who meet this giant serpent’s eye. Spiders flee before it.’ Ron, this is it. The monster in the Chamber of Secrets is a basilisk. That’s why I can hear it speak. It’s a snake!

Because no one did look it in the eye. Not directly, at least. Colin saw it through his camera. Justin…Justin must have seen the basilisk through Nearly Headless Nick. Nick got the full blast of it- but he’s a ghost- he couldn’t die again. And Hermione…had the mirror. I bet you anything she was using it to look around corners, in case it came along.
The water. There was water on the floor that night. She only saw the basilisk’s reflection. ‘Spiders flee before it.’ It all fits!
Remember what Aragog said, about that girl fifty years ago? She died in a bathroom? What if she never left?
Lockhart may be useless, but he’s going to try and get into the Chamber. At least we can tell him what we know.
Professor, we have some information for you! Are you going somewhere?
You’re running away? After all that stuff you did in your books?
To ask you how you died.
This is it. This is it, Ron. I think this is the entrance to the Chamber of Secrets.
Oh, yes there is! You first.
Now remember, any sign of movement, close your eyes straightaway.
You wait here and try and shift some of this rock so we can get back through. I’ll go on and find Ginny!
Ginny… Ginny! Oh, Ginny, please don’t be dead. Wake up. Wake up! Please, wake up!
Tom. Tom Riddle! What do you mean, ‘she won’t wake?’ She’s not…?
She’s cold as ice. Ginny, please don’t be dead. Wake up! You’ve got to help me, Tom. There’s a basilisk.
Listen, we’ve got to go! We’ve got to save her!
But, why did you want to meet me?
Hagrid’s my friend! And you framed him, didn’t you?
I’ll bet Dumbledore saw right through you.
Well, you haven’t finished it this time. In a few hours, the Mandrake Draught will be ready, and everyone who was Petrified will be all right again.
Why do you care how I escaped? Voldemort was after your time.
You! You’re the Heir of Slytherin. You’re Voldemort.
Albus Dumbledore is the greatest sorcerer in the world!
He’ll never be gone! Not as long as those who remain are loyal to him! Fawkes?

Don’t worry. Ginny, you need to get yourself out. Follow the Chamber, and you’ll find Ron. You were brilliant, Fawkes. I just wasn’t quick enough… Of course! Phoenix tears have healing powers. Thanks! It’s alright, Ginny. It’s over. It’s just a memory.
It’s just… You see, sir I- I couldn’t help but notice certain things, certain- certain similarities, between Tom Riddle and me.
Voldemort transferred some of his powers… to me?
So the Sorting Hat was right! I should be in Slytherin.
Sir, I wonder if I could have that?
Mr. Malfoy! Mr. Malfoy! I have something of yours.
Oh, I think you do, sir. I think you slipped the diary into Ginny Weasley’s cauldron, that day at Diagon Alley.
Never try to save my life again.
Well, we had loads of help from you. We couldn’t have done it without you.
Well, there’s no Hogwarts without you, Hagrid.
We still sound like ourselves. You need to sound more like Crabbe.
I think the Slytherin common room’s this way.
But then you must have some idea who’s behind it all.
I can’t let you out, Hedwig. I’m not allowed to use magic outside of school. Besides, if Uncle Vernon…
Sorry about him. He doesn't understand what it's like, lying there day after day, having people press their ugly faces in on you.

Can you...hear me? {The snake nods} It's just...I've never talked to a snake before. Do you...I mean...do you talk to people often? {The snake shakes its head} You're from Burma, aren't you? Was it nice there, do you miss your family? {The snake turns its head in the direction of a sign which says, Bred in Captivity} I see. That's me as well. I never knew my parents, either.
I swear I don't know! One minute the glass was there and then it was gone! It was like magic!
Hey, give it back! It's mine!

{Hands cookie to Vernon} Because there's no post on Sunday? Ah, right you are, Harry. No post on Sunday. Hah! No blasted letters today. No, sir. {Harry sees a shadow outside the window. Outside, millions of owls are perched.} No sir, not one blasted, miserable---
They're my letters! Let go of me!
Thank you! {Opens cake, which reads Happee Birdae Harry.}
{puts cake down} Excuse me, who are you?
A wizard. And a thumping good one at that, I'd wager. Once you train up a little.
No, you've made a mistake. I can't be...a-a wizard. I mean, I'm just... Harry. Just Harry.
Dear, Mr. Potter. We are pleased to inform you that you have been accepted at Hogwarts' School of Witchcraft and Wizardry!
You knew?? You knew all along and you never told me?
Blown up? You told me my parents died in a car crash!
All students must be equipped with...one standard size two pewter cauldron and may bring if they desire either an owl, a cat or a toad. Can we find all this in London?
Oh, nice to meet you. {Puts out hand. Quirrell refuses}
But why am I famous, Hagrid? All those people back there, how is it they know who I am?
But, Hagrid, how am I to pay for all this? I haven't any money.
Uh, Hagrid, what exactly are those things?
Oh! {waves. All the shelves come crashing down. Harry jumps and hurriedly puts the wand back on the counter.}
He killed my parents, didn't he? The one who gave me this. You know, Hagrid, I know you do.
Maybe if you wrote it down?
Platform 9 ¾? But Hagrid, there must be a mistake. This says Platform 9 ¾. There's no such thing...is there? {Harry looks up and Hagrid has vanished.}
Excuse me, Sir. Can you tell me where I might find Platform 9 ¾?
Excuse me! C-could you tell me how to
{pulls out coins} We'll take the lot!
{picks up blue and gold package} These aren't real chocolate frogs, are they?
I think I can tell who the wrong sort are for myself, thanks.
Say, Percy, who's that teacher talking to Professor Quirrell?
What's Seamus trying to do to that glass of water?
Can I borrow this? {Ron nods} Thanks.

Hey, Ron, somebody broke into Gringotts. Listen, Believed to be the work of dark witches or wizards unknown, Gringotts goblins, while acknowledging the breach, insist that nothing was taken. The vault in question, number 713, had in fact been emptied earlier that same day. That's odd. That's the vault Hagrid and I went to.
Whoa. {Hermione stares as the class continues.}
Give it here, Malfoy, or I'll knock you off your broom!
But I've never even played Quidditch. What if I make a fool of myself?
Does anyone feel like...we shouldn't be here?

And for good reason. {Ron and Hermione turn to stand with Harry. There is a massively huge three headed dog sleeping in front of them. The dog, FLUFFY, begins to wake. It growls, yawns, and growls more...noticing the intruders.}
{throws back} I think so. What are those? {points to two squirming chained down balls.}
What do I do with it?
I think we're going to need another feather over here, Professor.
How could a troll get in?
He's going into the Girl's Bathroom!
Whooa! Whoa, whoa! {He lands on the troll's head, and is hurled forward, then back, and his wand goes up the troll's nose.}
I don't think so. Just knocked out. {He grabs his wand...which is covered in goo.} Ew. Troll bogies.
Listen, last night, I'm guessing Snape let the troll in as a diversion so he could try and get past that 3 headed dog. But, he got himself bitten, that's why he's limping.
The day I was at Gringotts, Hagrid took something out of one of the vaults. He said it was Hogwarts' business, very secret.
That's what the dog's guarding. That's what Snape wants.
Yes! {a bludger zooms by him.} Whoa!
Who knows. Why was he trying to get past that 3 headed dog on Halloween?
But Hagrid, whatever Fluffy's guarding, Snape's trying to steal it!
Happy Christmas, Ron. What are you wearing?
"Your father left this in my possession before he died. It is time it was returned to you. Use it well."
{comes over} There was no name. It just said, "Use it well."
{Reading books} Famous fire eaters...15th Century Fiends...Flamel...Nicholas Flamel...where are you?

Mum? {the woman nods and smiles} Dad? {nods and smiles. Harry reaches out to touch them, but only gets the mirror. Then, his mother puts her hand on his shoulder. He puts his own hand on his own shoulders, as if trying to feel her there.
Ron! You've really got to see this! Ron! You've got to see this! {pulls back covers. Ron wakes up.} Ron, Ron, come on. Get out of bed!
There's something you've got to see. Now, come on!
Come on. Come. Come look, it's my parents!
{moves over} Look in properly. Go on. Stand there. There. You see them, don't you? Thats my dad
How can it? Both my parents are dead. {Harry smiles sadly.}
So, then it shows us what we want? Whatever we want?
We think Snape's trying to steal it.
Hagrid, we know he's after the Stone. We just don't know why.
Wait a minute. {Ron and a big black boarhound, FANG, meet. Fang sniffs Ron.} One of the teachers?
Uh, Hagrid, what exactly is that?
Hagrid always wanted a dragon. He told me so the first time I met him.
I don't understand. Is that bad?
If I didn't know better, Draco, I'd say you were scared.
{rises} But what was that thing you saved me from?
But who would choose such a life?
Do you mean to say...that that thing that killed the unicorn...that was drinking its blood...that was Voldemort?

But he's weak. He's living off the unicorns. Don't you see? We had it wrong. Snape doesn't want the stone for himself, he wants the stone for Voldemort. With the Elixir of Life, Voldemort will be strong again. He'll He'll come back. {Sits down.}
I think if he'd had the chance, he might have tried to kill me tonight.
I think it's a warning. It means dangers coming. Uhh! {He rubs scar and then sees Hagrid across the field, at his hut.} Oh. Of course! {runs for hut.}

Don't you think it's a bit odd that what Hagrid wants more than anything is a dragon, and a stranger shows up and just happens to have one? {They approach Hagrid, who is playing the Harry Potter theme on his flute.} I mean, how many people wander around with dragon eggs in their pockets? Why didn't I see it before? Hagrid, who gave you the dragon egg? {Hagrid stops playing.} What did he look like?
The stranger, though, you and he must have talked.
And did he seem interested in Fluffy?
We have to see Professor Dumbledore, immediately!
He's gone?! Now? But this is important! It's about...the Philosopher's Stone.
Someone's going to try and steal it.
That was no stranger Hagrid met in the village. It was Snape, which means he knows how to get past Fluffy.
We go down the trapdoor. Tonight.
Snape's already been here. He's put a spell on the harp. {They approach the sleeping dog.}
We have to move its paw.

Come on! {grabs paw, which is blocking the door.} Okay. Push! {They strain and move it. They open the door.} I'll go first. Don't follow until I give you a sign. {Fluffy's eyes open.} If something bad happens, get yourselves out...Does it seem a bit...quiet?
Jump! Go! {They all jump through the trapdoor.}
Whoa! {The plant begins to move towards them.} Oh. Ahh! {The plant ties them up.}
Lucky Hermione pays attention in Herbology.
I don't know. Sounds like wings.
They're not birds, they're keys. And I'll bet one of them fits that door. {They come upon a broomstick, suspended in the air.}
There! I see it! {points} The one with the broken wing! {He looks at the broom.}

RON! {Hermione starts walking to him.} NO! Don't move! Dont forget, we're still playing. {Hermione moves back. Harry walks the diagonal in front of the King.} Checkmate. {The Kings sword falls onto the ground victory. Harry breathes out and then the two run to Ron. They bend beside him.} Take care of Ron. Then, go to the owlery. Send a message to Dumbledore. Ron's right...I have to go on.
You? {Quirrell turns around.} No. It can't be...Snape. He was the one
B-but, that day, during the Quidditch Match, Snape tried to kill me.
Th-then you let the troll in.
I-I'm shaking hands with Dumbledore. I've won the house cup.
Ahhhhhhhhh! {Voldemort flies away. Harry falls to the ground, unconscious. He holds the stone in an outstretched hand.}
Ron was here? Is he all right? What about Hermione?
But, what happened to the Stone?
But Flamel, he'll die, won't he?
How is it I got the Stone, sir? One minute I was staring in the mirror, and the next...
Does that mean, with the Stone gone, I mean, that Voldemort can never come back?
One minute. {He walks over to Hagrid.}
Thanks, Hagrid. {Shakes Hagrid's hand, then hugs him tightly.}
But Hagrid, we're not allowed to do magic away from Hogwarts. You know that.
I'm not going home. Not really.
If you did destroy each Horcrux....
I don't know what you're up to,
in The Daily Prophet really moving.
Well, I certainly knew him the longest.
That is, if you don't count his brother,
- I didn't even know he had a brother.
very private, even as a boy.
Word has it that someone talked to her.
Both you and I know who that is,
I used to come to the theater here
I don't know why I thought of it.
It just popped into my head.
Lock the door, get the lights.
He was on the Astronomy Tower
This is Dolohov. I recognize him
So, what we gonna do with you, hey?
Kill us if it was turned round,
If we kill them, they'll know we were here.
How is it they knew we were there?
I have stolen the real Horcrux
did he actually destroy the real Horcrux?
You've been spying on us, have you?
Have you ever seen this before?
But there were two, weren't there?
Yes, but did you ever see it?
Where am I supposed to find a tent?
I mean, it's as if his life depends on it.
Good to know your enchantments work.
He could smell it. My perfume.
Well, then, we'll go on foot.
And next time, Hermione, as much as
I like your perfume, just don't wear any.
Thankfully, the list is short today.
Bella, Jake, Charlie, and Madge Farley.
Maybe you could tell me now.
Dirt and rust have no effect
If you tell me you've got one of those...
- ...in that bloody beaded bag of yours....
In the Chamber of Secrets, you stabbed
the Basilisk with the sword of Gryffindor.
That's why Dumbledore left it to you
allows me to look past extraneous detail...
Are you coming or you staying?
I saw you two the other night.
Poor old Jim's white as a ghost
He's found the answer that we lost
There ain't nothing we can do
Hey, little train, we're jumping on
The train that goes to the kingdom
And the train ain't even left the station
Hey, little train, wait for me
I once was blind but now I see
Have you left a seat for me?
Is that such a stretch of the imagination?
Hey, little train, wait for me
I was held in chains but now I'm free
Hey, little train, we're jumping on
The train that goes to the kingdom
Hey, little train, we're jumping on
The train that goes to the kingdom
The train ain't even left the station
...but I didn't catch the first Snitch
with my hand, I almost swallowed it.
- What Do you think that means?
At first I thought it was an eye,
but now I don't think it is.
It isn't a rune, and it isn't anywhere
It isn't part of the book. Somebody drew it.
I want to go to Godric's Hollow.
That's exactly where he'll expect you to go
because it means something to you.
Yeah, but it means something to him too,
I mean, isn't that exactly the type of place
he'd be likely to hide a Horcrux?
But even I have to admit, recently
I've been thinking we'll have to go there.
Miss Bagshot, who is this man?
I came here once with Mom and Dad,
It's just how I remember it.
If I brought my parents back here now,
they probably wouldn't recognize any of it.
Not the trees, not the river...
Maybe we should just stay here, Harry.
who the boy in the photograph was.
Speaking of which, where is my wand?
As we were leaving Godric's Hollow,
I cast a curse and it rebounded.
- I tried to mend It, But wands are different.
I'll take the locket as well.
Well, yeah. Bit obvious, I think.
And you cast the doe as well, did you?
- No, I thought that was you.
- No, My Patronus Is a stag.
I can't handle it. That thing affects me
more than it affects you and Hermione.
Now, I'll have to speak to it in order for it
to open. When it does, don't hesitate.
I don't know what's in there,
but it'll put up a fight.
The bit of Riddle that was in that diary
she would have preferred me as a son.
Actually, you know, it's more than fine.
You show up here after weeks,
- Where's my wand? Where's my wand?
- Harry Potter, Give me My wand.
- How come he's got your wand?
- Never mind why he's got my wand.
And how is it that you just happen
to have the sword of Gryffindor?
I only just destroyed a bloody Horcrux.
Look, I wanted to come back
- I just didn't know how to find you.
Yeah, how did you find us?
With this. It doesn't just turn off lights.
I don't know how it works, but Christmas
morning I was sleeping in this little pub...
- and What Exactly did I say, may I ask?
So I took it, clicked it,
and this tiny ball of light appeared.
And sure enough, it floated toward me,
And I knew it was gonna take me
where I needed to go, so I Disapparated...
It was dark. I had no idea where I was.
that one of you would show yourself.
Well, just keep talking about that
little ball of light touching your heart...
left it to me, the Deluminator.
I think he knew that somehow I'd need it
to find my way back, and she'd lead me.
you need a wand, don't you?
Nothing special, but I reckon it'll do.
but they're a bit dim, Snatchers.
This one was definitely part troll,
Look, you've got no idea where
the next Horcrux is, and neither do I...
Let's vote on it. Those in favor?
You're not still mad at him, are you?
But it's really you they want.
Is there no one we can trust?
Well, don't hang about, snatch them.
...but he's only after one of them,
the last one. He knows where it is.
He's gonna have it by the end of the night.
[notices the canister of liquid Hagrid is carrying] What's that you've got, Hagrid?
No, Colin! Get out of the way. [he and Hermione help Ron to his feet] Let's take him to Hagrid. [Ron regurgitates another slug] He'll know what to do.
Do you know anything about the Chamber of Secrets?
It was Hagrid, Hagrid opened the Chamber of Secrets fifty years ago.
We know one thing. Hagrid never opened the Chamber of Secrets. He was innocent.

"Of the many fearsome beasts that roam our land, none is more deadly than the basilisk. Capable of living for hundreds of years, instant death awaits any who meet this giant serpent's eye. Spiders flee before it."
There's no Hogwarts without you, Hagrid.
Hermione! Bad dream. When did you get here?
Ron, where are we actually going?
I suppose I'll have to kill him before he finds me, then.
He knows. You-Know-Who. He knows we broke into Gringotts, he knows what we took, and he knows we're hunting Horcruxes.
Hermione, I can't always help it! Well, maybe I can, I don't know.

Well, he's angry, and he's scared too. He knows if we find and destroy all the Horcruxes, we'll be able to kill him. I reckon he'll stop at nothing to make sure we don't find the rest. There's more. One of them's at Hogwarts.
I saw the castle. And Rowena Ravenclaw. They must have something to do with her. We have to go there, now.
Hermione, when have any of our plans ever actually worked? We plan, we get there, all hell breaks loose.

Well, we'll go to Hogsmeade, to Honeyduke's. Take the secret passage in the cellar. It's... There's something wrong with him. It's like, you know, in the past, I've always been able to follow his thoughts. And now, everything just feels disconnected.
No. No, it's...it's more like he's wounded. If anything, he feels more dangerous.
You’re Aberforth, Dumbledore's brother. It's you that I've been seeing in here. You're the one who sent Dobby.
Who gave that to you? The mirror?
Dung had no right sending it to you. It belongs to...
We need to get into Hogwarts, tonight. Dumbledore gave us a job to do.
We've been hunting Horcruxes. We think the last one's inside the castle, but we'll need your help in getting in.
Dumbledore trusted me to see this through.
I'm not interested in what happened between you and your brother. I don't care that you've given up. I trusted the man I knew. We need to get into the castle tonight.
Okay, there's something we need to find, something hidden here in the castle, and it may help us defeat You-Know-Who.
We don't know that either. I realize that's not much to go on.

[coldly] It seems despite your exhaustive defensive strategies, you still have a bit of a security problem, Headmaster. [Order of Phoenix members enter] And I'm afraid it's quite extensive. How dare you stand where he stood. Tell them how it happened that night! How you looked him in the eye, a man who trusted you, and killed him! Tell them!
Time, Professor. As much as you can get me.
It’s good to see you, too, Professor. [leaves]
I'm a bit preoccupied at the moment, Luna.
You're the Grey Lady. The Ghost of Ravenclaw Tower.
No, I'm sorry. I'm sorry. It's Helena, isn't it? Helena Ravenclaw. Rowena's daughter.
Yes. And she thought you might be able to help me.
Wait! Please! I want to destroy it. [pause] That's what you want too, isn't it, Helena? You want it destroyed.
I can destroy it once and for all. But only if you tell me where he hid it. You do know where he hid it, don't you, Helena? You just have to tell me. Please.
[Nudging to his wand] Well, what's wrong with the one you have?
Why didn't you tell her? Bellatrix? You knew it was me. But you didn't say anything.
[Walking into a clearing in the Forest, Harry pulls the Snitch from his pocket] I'm ready to die. [He kisses it, and it opens to reveal a small black stone] The Resurrection Stone...
Why are you here, all of you?
I'm sorry. I never wanted any of you to die for me. And Remus, your son...
And he won't be able to see you?
Well, it looks like King's Cross Station, only cleaner, and without all the trains.
So it's true then, isn't it, Sir? A part of him lives in me, doesn't it?
I have to go back, haven't I?
And where would it take me?
And I've nothing to kill it with.
Professor, my mother's Patronus was a doe, wasn't it? It's the same as Professor Snape's. It's curious, don't you think?
Professor? Is this all real? Or is it just happening inside my head?
Professor, what shall I do? Professor?
[to Ron, Hermione, and Neville] I'll lure him into the castle! We have to kill the snake.
You were right. When you told Professor Snape that wand was failing you, It will always fail you.
But what if the Wand never belonged to Snape? What if its allegiance was always to someone else? Come on, Tom. Let's finish this the way we started it

It answered to somebody else. When he killed Snape, he thought the Wand would become his, but the thing is, the Wand never belonged to Snape. It was Draco who disarmed Dumbledore that night at the Astronomy Tower. From that moment on, the Wand answered to him, until... the other night, when I disarmed Draco at Malfoy Manor.
Albus Severus Potter, you were named after two headmasters of Hogwarts. One of them was a Slytherin, and he was the bravest man I've ever known.
Then Slytherin House will have gained a wonderful, young wizard. But, listen, if it really means that much to you, you can choose Gryffindor. The Sorting Hat takes your choice into account.
[Quickly removes his glasses] Um... Um... reading.
I do not answer to that name.
Are you a friend of Luna's?
Luna is kind, unlike so many of the others. But she was wrong. I cannot help you.
Another swore to destroy it many years ago... a strange boy with a strange name.
I know what he's done! I know who he is! HE DEFILED IT WITH DARK MAGIC!
Strange. You remind me of him a bit. It's here, in the castle, in the place where everything is hidden. If you have to ask, you will never know. If you know, you need only ask.
Oh, it’s so good to see you!
What did you do to your glasses? Oculus reparo.
Come on! Everyone’s been so worried.
Fear of a name only increase fear of the thing itself.
Mandrake, or Mandragora, is used to return those who have been Petrified to their original state. It’s also quite dangerous. The Mandrake’s cry is fatal to anyone who hears it.
At least no one on the Gryffindor team had to buy their way in. They got it on pure talent.
It means “dirty blood.” Mudblood’s a really foul name for someone who is Muggle-born. Someone with non-magic parents. Someone like me. It’s not a term one usually hears in civilized conversation.
‘The Chamber of Secrets has been opened… enemies the heir… beware.’ It’s written in blood.
That’s why Ron and I went looking for him, Professor. We’d just found him when he said…
It’s a bit strange, isn’t it?
You hear this voice, a voice only you can hear, and then Mrs. Norris turns up Petrified. It’s just… strange.
No, Harry. Even in the wizarding world, hearing voices isn’t a good sign.
Professor, I was wondering if you could tell us about…the Chamber of Secrets?
Professor? What exactly does legend tell us lies within the Chamber?
Yes. Couldn’t you tell? McGonagall’s worried. All the teachers are.
The Heir of Slytherin has returned to Hogwarts. The question is, who is it?
I heard him. But Malfoy, the Heir of Slytherin?
Even they aren’t that thick. But there might be another way. Mind you, it would be difficult. Not to mention, we would be breaking about fifty school rules. And, it’ll be dangerous. Very dangerous.

Here it is. ‘The Polyjuice Potion.’ (Reading from Moste Potente Potions) ‘Properly brewed, the Polyjuice Potion allows the drinker to transform himself temporarily into the physical form of another.’ RON Do you mean, if Harry and I drink that stuff, we’ll turn into Crabbe and Goyle?
Exactly. But it’s tricky. I’ve never seen a more complicated potion.
I know. But it’s the only plan we’ve got.
No! Even with a proper wand it’s too risky. You could hit Harry!
You will be able to, won’t you?
Again? You mean the Chamber of Secrets has been opened before? RON Of course. Don’t you see? Lucius Malfoy must have opened it when he was at school here. And now he’s taught Draco how to do it.
Maybe. We’ll have to wait for the Polyjuice Potion to know for sure.
Heh… No. No one ever comes in here.
Do you think he’s all right?
No, they can’t. It’s not a very common gift, Harry. This is bad.

I don’t know, Harry, but it sounded like you were egging the snake on, or something. Harry, listen to me. There’s a reason the symbol of Slytherin House is a serpent. Salazar Slytherin was a Parselmouth. He could talk to snakes, too.
He lived a thousand years ago; for all we know, you could be.
Everything’s set. We just need a bit of who you’re changing into. HARRY Crabbe and Goyle.
We also need to make sure that the real Crabbe and Goyle can’t burst in on us while we’re interrogating Malfoy.

I’ve got it all worked out. I filled these with a simple Sleeping Draught. Simple, but powerful. Now, once they’re asleep hide them in the broomstick cupboard and pull out a few of their hairs, and put on their uniforms.
I’ve already got mine. Millicent Bulstrode– Slytherin- I got this off her robes. I’m going to go check on the Polyjuice Potion. Make sure that Crabbe and Goyle find these.
We’ll have exactly one hour before we change back into ourselves… Add the hairs.
I- I don’t think I’m going. You go on without me!
Do you remember me telling you that the Polyjuice Potion was only for human transformations? It was cat’s hair I plucked off Millicent Bulstrode’s robes. Look at my face.
It can’t be Hagrid. It just can’t be.
Look. Hagrid’s our friend. Why don’t we just go and ask him about it?
It had to be a Gryffindor. Nobody else knows our password- unless it wasn’t a student.
It’s good to be back! Congratulations! I can’t believe you solved it!
Has anyone seen a toad? A boy named Neville's lost one.
Oh, are you doing magic? Let's see then.

Are you sure that's a real spell? Well, it's not very good, is it? Of course I've only tried a few simple spells myself, and they've all worked for me. For example...{Hermione goes over and sits across from Harry. He points her hand at his glasses and Harry tenses} Oculus Reparo. {The glasses, which noseband is battered, are repaired. Harry takes them off, amazed.} That's better, isn't it? Holy Cricket, you're Harry Potter. I'm Hermione Granger...and you are...?

Pleasure. You two better change into your robes. I expect we'll be arriving soon. {Gets up and leaves, then comes back and looks at Ron.} You've got dirt, on your nose, by the way, did you know? Just there. {Points} {Ron scratches his nose, embarrassed.}
It's not real, the ceiling. It's just bewitched to look like the night sky. I read about it in Hogwarts A History.
Oh, no. Okay, relax. {She goes up}
Nearly headless? How can you be nearly headless?
I've read about those. When the smoke turns red {the smoke turns red}, it means you've forgotten something.
Harry, no! You heard what Madam Hooch said! Besides, you don't even know how to fly. {Harry flies off.} What an idiot.
You won't make a fool of yourself. It's in your blood.
The staircases change, remember? {The staircase stops, in a new place.}
We're not supposed to be here. This is the 3rd floor. It's forbidden.
Oh, move over! {pushes through and pulls out wand} Alohomora. {The door opens.} Get in. {They bustle in.}
You don't use your eyes, do you? Didn't you see what it was standing on?
It was standing on a trap door. Which means it wasn't there by accident. It's guarding something.

That's right. Now, if you two don't mind, I'm going to bed before either of you come up with another clever idea to get us killed...or worse, expelled! {turns and leaves, shutting the door to her dorms.}
Stop, stop, stop. You're going to take someone's eye out. Besides, youre saying it wrong. It's Leviosa, not Leviosar.
{crisply} Wingardium Leviosa. {The feather glows and lifts up. Ron puts his head on his books dejectedly.}
Help! Help! {The boys start throwing wood pieces at the troll.}
It's my fault, Professor McGonagall. {The teachers, and Ron and Harry, gape}
I went looking for the troll. I'd read about them and thought I could handle it. But I was wrong. If Harry and Ron hadn't come and found me...I'd probably be dead.
Ron's right, Harry. You're gonna need your strength today.
But why would anyone go near that dog?
Bit early for mail, isn't it?
It's Snape! He's jinxing the broom!
Leave it to me. {She hands Ron her binoculars and leaves.}
Hogwarts teacher or not, I know a curse when I see one. I've read all about them. You have to keep eye contact. And Snape wasn't blinking.
Good. You can help Harry, then. He's going to go the library for information on Nicholas Flamel.
Not in the restricted section...Happy Christmas. {exits.}
I had you looking in the wrong section! How could I be so stupid? I checked this out a few weeks ago for a bit of light reading.
{glares} Of course! Here it is! "Nicholas Flamel is the only known maker of the Philosopher's Stone!"

Honestly, don't you two read? "The Philosopher's Stone is a legendary substance with astonishing powers. It will turn any metal into pure gold and produces the Elixir of Life, which will make the drinker immortal."

"The only stone currently in existence belongs to Mr. Nicholas Flamel, the noted alchemist, who last year celebrated his 665th birthday!" That's what Fluffy's guarding on the 3rd floor. That's what's under the trapdoor...the Philosopher's Stone!
{sitting in a large chair} Of course! There are other things defending the Stone, aren't there? Spells, enchantments.
Well, that's good, isn't it? He'll be with his own kind.
You mean, You-Know-Who's out there, right now, in the forest?
Hang on a minute. We're forgetting one thing. Who's the one wizard Voldemort always feared?
I've always heard Hogwarts' end of the year exams were frightful, but I found that rather enjoyable.
Neville, I'm really, really sorry about this...{takes out wand} Petrificus Totalus.
Ow! You stood on my foot!
Stop moving, both of you. This is Devil's Snare. You have to relax. If you don't, it will only kill you faster.

Uh! I remember reading something in Herbology. {Ron Help!} Um Devil's Snare, Devil's Scare, {The snare shuts Ron's mouth} it's deadly fun...but will sulk in the sun! That's it! Devil's Snare hates sunlight! {takes out wand and points upwards.} Lumus Solem! {A beam of light shoots out. The Snare shrieks and recoils. Ron falls below.}
Curious. I've never seen birds like these.
Ugh! What're we going to do? There must be 1000 keys up there!
I don't like this. I don't like this at all.
Ron, you don't suppose this is going to be like...real wizard's chess, do you?
No, Ron, you can't! {Ron closes his eyes.} There must be another way!
You'll be okay, Harry. You're a great wizard, you really are.
{smile} Me? Books and cleverness? There are more important things. Friendship, and bravery. And Harry, just be careful.
Feels strange to be going home, doesn't it?
Harry! Harry is flustered and still panicing.
Honestly. Get dressed, and don't go back to sleep. Come on Ron! Your mother says breakfast's ready.
This is horrible, how can the ministry not know who conjured it. Isn't there any security or?
It's hurting again isn't it, your scar.
You know Sirius will want to hear about this. What you saw at the world cup, and the dream. Harry has written a letter, he marks Sirius Black on an envelope and gives it to an owl.
Because they are unforgivable. Use of any one of them will...
Stop it! Can't you see it's bothering him, stop it! Mad-Eye stops. Neville is disturbed. Mad-Eye picks up the spider which is still making a noise.
There's a reason those curses are unforgivable, and to perform them in a classroom. I mean did you see Neville's face. They see a boy on the stairs facing the window.
Neville? Mad-Eye approaches Neville and pats him on the shoulder.
You see this? This is an age line. Dumbledore drew it himself.
So a genius like Dumbledore couldn't possibly be fooled by something pathetically dimwitted such as an age potion.
Go on Harry. Harry for goodness sake. Harry slowly walks up. Dumbledore gives him the paper. Voices in the crowd shout out.

(Whispering to Ron) We've already been through enough people why don't you just go and do it yourself? Ughh. What do you want me to say again? Ron whispers some words to Hermione. It's clear Ron and Harry are not on speaking terms. Hermione walks up to Harry.
Ronald would like me to tell you that Seamus told him that Dean was told by Parvati that Hagrid was looking for you.
Uhhh... She walks back to Ron for more whispering and comes back.
Dean was told by Parvati that... Please don't ask me say it again. Hagrid's looking for you.
How are you feeling? OK? The key is to concentrate. After that you just have to...
Oh um.. Sorry I'll just go.
Your wand harry! Your wand! Harry summons a broom. He jumps on and flies off, the dragon gives chase. The dragon bursts through the crowd and they look stunned.

(Reading a newspaper) Look at this! I can't believe it she's done it again. Miss Granger a plain but ambitious girl seems to be developing a taste for famous wizards. Her latest prey sources report is none other than the Bulgarian bon-bon Viktor Krum. No word yet on how Harry Potter's taking this latest emotional blow. A young boy walks up holding a package.
They're not for Ginny they're for you! Dress robes.
It might interest you to know that Neville's already got someone. Ron gasps.
I won't be going alone because believe it or not someone's asked me. And I said yes.
No of course. Ron shakes his head.
Hot isn't it? Viktor's gone to get drinks. Care to join us?
What's got your wand in a knot?
The enemy?? Who was it wanting his autograph? Besides, the whole point of the tournament is international magical cooperation, to make friends.
How dare you! Besides I can take care of myself.
What? What? That's what you think?
You know the solution then don't you.
Next time there's a ball pluck up the courage and ask me before somebody else does, and not as a last resort.
Where have you been? Nevermind! Off to bed both of you. Harry and Ron walk away.
Harry you told me you'd figured the egg out weeks ago. The task is two days from now.

I wouldn't know, we didn't actually talk about the tournament. Actually we didn't really talk at all, Viktor's more of a physical being. I just mean he's not particularly... Mostly he watches me study. It's a bit annoying actually. You are trying to figure this egg out aren't you?

I mean these tasks are supposed to test you, in the most brutal way they're almost cruel. And um, I'm scared for you. You got by the dragon mostly on nerve, I'm not sure it's going to be enough this time.
Again obvious, though I must admit potentially problematic
Look Harry, we can do this. The three of us can figure it out. Mad-Eye Moody appears in the doorway.
But sir, the second task is only hours away and...
Are you alright? You must be freezing! Personally I think you behaved admirably. Hermione kisses Harry on the head.
Bye. Ron is sitting alone. The french sisters approach him, they both in turn give him a kiss on the head.
Everything's going to change now isn't it?
Promise you'll write this summer. Both of you.
Has anyone seen a toad? A boy named Neville has lost one.
[sees Ron attempting magic] Oh, are you doing magic? Let's see then.

Are you sure that's a real spell? Well, it's not very good is it? [Ron gives Harry an indignant and exasperated look] Of course, I've only tried a few simple ones myself, but they've all worked for me. For example, [sits in front of Harry] Oculus Reparo.
[chagrined] Pleasure. You two best change into robes, I expect we'll be arriving soon. [leaves, but turns around to face Ron] You've got dirt on your nose, by the way. Did you know? Just there.
You don't use your eyes, do you? Didn't you see what it was standing on?
It was standing on a trapdoor. Which means, it wasn't there by accident. It's guarding something.
That's right. Now, if you two don't mind, I'm going to bed before either of you come up with another clever idea to get us killed. Or worse, expelled. [Goes into her dormitory]
Hogwarts teacher or not, I know a spell when I see one. I've read all about them. You've got to keep eye contact and Snape wasn't blinking.
We... [Snape looks to her, expecting an answer]...we were just...
Feels strange to be going home, doesn't it?
Look at you playing with your cards. Pathetic! We've got final exams coming up soon.
All right, what are the three most crucial ingredients in a Forgetfulness Potion?
And what, may I ask, do you plan to do if this comes up in the final exam?
No, you won't! Besides, according to Professor McGonagall, we're to be given special quills bewitched with an anti-cheating spell.
[Indirectly quoting Dumbledore] Fear of a name only increases fear of the thing itself.
At least no one on the Gryffindor team had to buy their way in. They got in on pure talent.
You okay, Ron? [Ron's face turns green] Say something!
[concerned] Do you think he's all right?
Look, Hagrid is our friend, so why don't we just go and ask him?
It's a cat, Ronald; what do you expect? It's in his nature.
That's rich, coming from the owner of that smelly old shoebrush.
Um... no one blames you, Harry. The Dementors aren't supposed to come inside the grounds. Dumbledore was furious. As soon as he saved you, he sent them straight off.
[furiously] You! You foul, loathsome, evil, little cockroach! [holds Malfoy at wandpoint]
Because they are unforgivable. The use of any one of them will...
Stop it! Can't you see it's bothering him?! Stop it!
Ronald would like me to tell you that Seamus told him that Dean was told by Parvati that Hagrid is looking for you.

[Goes back to Ron, talks to him quietly for a few seconds, then walks back] Dean was told by Parvati that... that... Please don't ask me to say it again! Hagrid is looking for you. [starts to walk away]
How dare you! Besides, I can take care of myself.
What? Is that what you think?
[on the verge of tears] You know the solution then, don’t you?
Next time there’s a ball, pluck up the courage and ask me before somebody else does, and not as a last resort!
Where have you been? Never mind. Off to bed, both of you!
Ron, you spoiled EVERYTHING!! [Breaks down in tears on the stairs]
[catching on his meaning] Wouldn't know, we don't actually talk about the tournament. Actually, we don't really talk at all. Viktor's more of a physical being.
[desperately trying to recover] I just mean he's not particularly loquacious. [Harry looks at her in amusement] Mostly, he watches me study. It's a bit annoying, actually.
Personally, I believe you behaved admirably.
Next to last. Fleur never got past "ze Grindylows."
Everything's going to change now, isn't it?
Promise you'll write this summer, both of you.
Nothing's pulling the carriage, Harry. It's pulling itself like always.
There's nothing in here about using defensive spells.
Your other hand. [grabs his left arm, and sees his scars from Umbridge's detention] [horrified] You've got to tell Dumbledore!
Harry, you've got to report this. It's perfectly simple - you're being-
Who cares? I mean, sort of exciting, isn't it, breaking the rules?
You've done it, Neville. You found the Room of Requirement.
It's also known as the Come and Go Room. The Room of Requirement only appears when a person has real need of it, and is always equipped for the seeker's needs.
Charming, Ronald. But yes, that's the idea.
Um... Hi! You all know why we're here. We need a teacher. A proper teacher. One who's had real experience defending themselves against the Dark Arts.
And last year he really did fight off You-Know-Who in the flesh.
You're right, Harry, we don't. That's why we need your help. Because if we're having any chance against beating... Voldemort.
[referring to Harry's kiss] Well, how was it?
I'm sure Harry's kissing is more than satisfactory. Cho spends half her time crying these days.

Don't you understand how she must be feeling? [Ron and Harry just stare at her] Well, obviously she's feeling sad about Cedric, and therefore confused about liking Harry and guilty about kissing him. Conflicted because Umbridge is threatening to sack her mother from her job at the Ministry and frightened of failing her O.W.L.'s because she's so busy worrying about everything else.
Just because you've got the emotional range of a teaspoon... [laughs]
Even Dumbledore didn't see this coming. Harry, if it's anyone's fault, it's ours.
When are you going to get it into your head?! We're in this together!
Well, if you won't tell her where it is, I will.
[To the centaurs] Leave him alone! It's not his fault! He doesn't understand!
[Running up with Harry to meet Ginny, Ron, Neville and Luna] How did you get away?
[smacks him on the arm with a book] Will you stop eating? Your best friend is missing!
My parents are dentists. [Everyone except Harry looks at her in confusion] They tend to people's teeth.
No... Although, one boy, Robbie Fenwick did bite my father once. He needed ten stitches.
[To Harry] You really shouldn't have done it.

That was different. That was tryouts. This was an actual game. [Harry takes the vial of Felix Felicis out of his shirt pocket and shows it to Hermione, who looks at it in confusion] You didn't put it in. Ron only thought you did.
How does it feel, Harry? When you see Dean with Ginny? I know. I see the way you look at her. You're my best friend.
[about Romilda Vane] She's only interested in you because she thinks you're the Chosen One.
On second thoughts... [Grabs tray and gobbles one] Maybe it'll keep Cormac at bay... oh God, here he comes!
I might ask you the same question!
I happen to be his... friend.
He's been poisoned, you daft dimbo! And for the record, I've always found him interesting.
Do you think he would've done it? Draco.
[opens the locket and reads the message] "To the Dark Lord
Ron's okay with it, you know. You and Ginny. If I were you when he's around, I'd keep snogging to a minimum.
I've always admired your courage, Harry. But sometimes, you can be really thick. You don't really think you're going to be able to find all those Horcruxes by yourself, do you? You need us, Harry.
[chuckles] Like that’s going to happen. Besides, he’s barking.
Told you he'd take it well.

Right. Remember what we said, don't speak to anyone unless absolutely necessary. Just, try and act normal. Do what everybody else is doing. If we do that then with a bit of luck, we'll get inside. Then...

[trying to intervene] Ron, please. [She tries to take the locket off of Ron, but he angrily shoves her away] Please take the Horcrux off! You won't be saying any of this if you hadn't been wearing it all day!
[tears in her eyes] Ron, that's; that's nothing!
[upon arriving at Godric's Hollow] We should have taken Polyjuice potion.
And what exactly did I say, may I ask?
No, he's right. I was being stupid.
Oh, it’s so good to see you!
What did you do to your glasses? Oculus reparo.
Come on! Everyone’s been so worried.
Fear of a name only increase fear of the thing itself.
Mandrake, or Mandragora, is used to return those who have been Petrified to their original state. It’s also quite dangerous. The Mandrake’s cry is fatal to anyone who hears it.
At least no one on the Gryffindor team had to buy their way in. They got it on pure talent.
It means “dirty blood.” Mudblood’s a really foul name for someone who is Muggle-born. Someone with non-magic parents. Someone like me. It’s not a term one usually hears in civilized conversation.
‘The Chamber of Secrets has been opened… enemies the heir… beware.’ It’s written in blood.
That’s why Ron and I went looking for him, Professor. We’d just found him when he said…
It’s a bit strange, isn’t it?
You hear this voice, a voice only you can hear, and then Mrs. Norris turns up Petrified. It’s just… strange.
No, Harry. Even in the wizarding world, hearing voices isn’t a good sign.
Professor, I was wondering if you could tell us about…the Chamber of Secrets?
Professor? What exactly does legend tell us lies within the Chamber?
Yes. Couldn’t you tell? McGonagall’s worried. All the teachers are.
The Heir of Slytherin has returned to Hogwarts. The question is, who is it?
I heard him. But Malfoy, the Heir of Slytherin?
Even they aren’t that thick. But there might be another way. Mind you, it would be difficult. Not to mention, we would be breaking about fifty school rules. And, it’ll be dangerous. Very dangerous.

Here it is. ‘The Polyjuice Potion.’ (Reading from Moste Potente Potions) ‘Properly brewed, the Polyjuice Potion allows the drinker to transform himself temporarily into the physical form of another.’ RON Do you mean, if Harry and I drink that stuff, we’ll turn into Crabbe and Goyle?
Exactly. But it’s tricky. I’ve never seen a more complicated potion.
I know. But it’s the only plan we’ve got.
No! Even with a proper wand it’s too risky. You could hit Harry!
You will be able to, won’t you?
Again? You mean the Chamber of Secrets has been opened before? RON Of course. Don’t you see? Lucius Malfoy must have opened it when he was at school here. And now he’s taught Draco how to do it.
Maybe. We’ll have to wait for the Polyjuice Potion to know for sure.
Heh… No. No one ever comes in here.
Do you think he’s all right?
No, they can’t. It’s not a very common gift, Harry. This is bad.

I don’t know, Harry, but it sounded like you were egging the snake on, or something. Harry, listen to me. There’s a reason the symbol of Slytherin House is a serpent. Salazar Slytherin was a Parselmouth. He could talk to snakes, too.
He lived a thousand years ago; for all we know, you could be.
Everything’s set. We just need a bit of who you’re changing into. HARRY Crabbe and Goyle.
We also need to make sure that the real Crabbe and Goyle can’t burst in on us while we’re interrogating Malfoy.

I’ve got it all worked out. I filled these with a simple Sleeping Draught. Simple, but powerful. Now, once they’re asleep hide them in the broomstick cupboard and pull out a few of their hairs, and put on their uniforms.
I’ve already got mine. Millicent Bulstrode– Slytherin- I got this off her robes. I’m going to go check on the Polyjuice Potion. Make sure that Crabbe and Goyle find these.
We’ll have exactly one hour before we change back into ourselves… Add the hairs.
I- I don’t think I’m going. You go on without me!
Do you remember me telling you that the Polyjuice Potion was only for human transformations? It was cat’s hair I plucked off Millicent Bulstrode’s robes. Look at my face.
It can’t be Hagrid. It just can’t be.
Look. Hagrid’s our friend. Why don’t we just go and ask him about it?
It had to be a Gryffindor. Nobody else knows our password- unless it wasn’t a student.
It’s good to be back! Congratulations! I can’t believe you solved it!
Has anyone seen a toad? A boy named Neville's lost one.
Oh, are you doing magic? Let's see then.

Are you sure that's a real spell? Well, it's not very good, is it? Of course I've only tried a few simple spells myself, and they've all worked for me. For example...{Hermione goes over and sits across from Harry. He points her hand at his glasses and Harry tenses} Oculus Reparo. {The glasses, which noseband is battered, are repaired. Harry takes them off, amazed.} That's better, isn't it? Holy Cricket, you're Harry Potter. I'm Hermione Granger...and you are...?

Pleasure. You two better change into your robes. I expect we'll be arriving soon. {Gets up and leaves, then comes back and looks at Ron.} You've got dirt, on your nose, by the way, did you know? Just there. {Points} {Ron scratches his nose, embarrassed.}
It's not real, the ceiling. It's just bewitched to look like the night sky. I read about it in Hogwarts A History.
Oh, no. Okay, relax. {She goes up}
Nearly headless? How can you be nearly headless?
I've read about those. When the smoke turns red {the smoke turns red}, it means you've forgotten something.
Harry, no! You heard what Madam Hooch said! Besides, you don't even know how to fly. {Harry flies off.} What an idiot.
You won't make a fool of yourself. It's in your blood.
The staircases change, remember? {The staircase stops, in a new place.}
We're not supposed to be here. This is the 3rd floor. It's forbidden.
Oh, move over! {pushes through and pulls out wand} Alohomora. {The door opens.} Get in. {They bustle in.}
You don't use your eyes, do you? Didn't you see what it was standing on?
It was standing on a trap door. Which means it wasn't there by accident. It's guarding something.

That's right. Now, if you two don't mind, I'm going to bed before either of you come up with another clever idea to get us killed...or worse, expelled! {turns and leaves, shutting the door to her dorms.}
Stop, stop, stop. You're going to take someone's eye out. Besides, youre saying it wrong. It's Leviosa, not Leviosar.
{crisply} Wingardium Leviosa. {The feather glows and lifts up. Ron puts his head on his books dejectedly.}
Help! Help! {The boys start throwing wood pieces at the troll.}
It's my fault, Professor McGonagall. {The teachers, and Ron and Harry, gape}
I went looking for the troll. I'd read about them and thought I could handle it. But I was wrong. If Harry and Ron hadn't come and found me...I'd probably be dead.
Ron's right, Harry. You're gonna need your strength today.
But why would anyone go near that dog?

Leave it to me. {She hands Ron her binoculars and leaves.}

Good. You can help Harry, then. He's going to go the library for information on Nicholas Flamel.
Not in the restricted section...Happy Christmas. {exits.}
I had you looking in the wrong section! How could I be so stupid? I checked this out a few weeks ago for a bit of light reading.

Honestly, don't you two read? "The Philosopher's Stone is a legendary substance with astonishing powers. It will turn any metal into pure gold and produces the Elixir of Life, which will make the drinker immortal."

"The only stone currently in existence belongs to Mr. Nicholas Flamel, the noted alchemist, who last year celebrated his 665th birthday!" That's what Fluffy's guarding on the 3rd floor. That's what's under the trapdoor...the Philosopher's Stone!
{sitting in a large chair} Of course! There are other things defending the Stone, aren't there? Spells, enchantments.
Well, that's good, isn't it? He'll be with his own kind.
You mean, You-Know-Who's out there, right now, in the forest?

I've always heard Hogwarts' end of the year exams were frightful, but I found that rather enjoyable.
Neville, I'm really, really sorry about this...{takes out wand} Petrificus Totalus.
Ow! You stood on my foot!
Stop moving, both of you. This is Devil's Snare. You have to relax. If you don't, it will only kill you faster.

Uh! I remember reading something in Herbology. {Ron Help!} Um Devil's Snare, Devil's Scare, {The snare shuts Ron's mouth} it's deadly fun...but will sulk in the sun! That's it! Devil's Snare hates sunlight! {takes out wand and points upwards.} Lumus Solem! {A beam of light shoots out. The Snare shrieks and recoils. Ron falls below.}
Curious. I've never seen birds like these.

I don't like this. I don't like this at all.

No, Ron, you can't! {Ron closes his eyes.} There must be another way!
You'll be okay, Harry. You're a great wizard, you really are.
{smile} Me? Books and cleverness? There are more important things. Friendship, and bravery. And Harry, just be careful.

Forest of Dean. I came here once with Mum and Dad. That was years ago. It's just how I remember it. The trees, the river, everything. Like nothing's changed... not true of course. Everything's changed. If I brought them back here now, they'd probably not recognize any of it. Not the trees, not the river... not even me. [Pause] Maybe we should just stay here, Harry. Grow old... [Another pause] You wanted to know who the boy in the photograph was. I know. Gellert Grindlewald. [Hands Harry The Life and Lies of Albus Dumbledore]
[Whacking Ron with a backpack with each word after he returns] You...complete...ARSE, Ronald Weasley! You show up here after WEEKS, and you say 'Hey'?!

[Reading the Tale of the Three Brothers] "There were once three brothers who were traveling along a lonely winding road, at twilight. In time, the brothers reached a river too treacherous to pass, but being learned in the magical arts, the three brothers simply waved their wands and made a bridge. Before they could cross, however, they found their path blocked by a hooded figure. It was Death, and he felt cheated. Cheated because travelers would normally drown in the river, but Death was cunning. He pretended to congratulate the three brothers on their magic and said that each had earned a prize for having been clever enough to evade him. The oldest asked for a wand more powerful than any in existence, so Death fashioned him one from an elder tree that stood nearby. The second brother decided he wanted to humiliate Death even further and asked for the power to recall loved ones from the grave, so Death plucked a stone from the river and offered it to him. Finally Death turned to the third brother. A humble man, he asked for something that would allow him to go forth from that place without being followed by Death. And so it was that Death reluctantly handed over his own Cloak of Invisibility. The first brother traveled to a distant village. While with the Elder Wand in hand, he killed a wizard with whom he had once quarreled. Drunk with the power that the Elder Wand had given him, he bragged of his invincibility. But that night, another wizard stole the wand and slit the brother's throat for good measure. And so Death took the first brother for his own. The second brother journeyed to his home, where he took the stone and turned it thrice in hand. To his delight, the girl he had once hoped to marry before her untimely death appeared before him. Yet soon she turned sad and cold, for she did not belong in the mortal world. Driven mad with hopeless longing, the second brother killed himself so as to join her. And so Death took the second brother. As for the third brother, Death searched for many years but was never able to find him. Only when he attained a great age did the youngest brother shed the Cloak of Invisibility and give it to his son. He then greeted Death as an old friend and went with him gladly, departing this life as equals."
[deleted scene] He's rather disagreeable, isn't he?
I'm going to bed before either of you come up with another clever idea to get us all killed. Or worse, expelled.

Good afternoon, Amanda, good afternoon. {to class} Welcome to your first flying lesson. Well, what are you waiting for? Everyone step up to the left side of their broomstick. Come on now, hurry up. Stick your right hand over the broom and say, Up!

Now, once you've got hold of your broom, I want you to mount it. And grip it tight, you don't want to be sliding off the end. {Class mounts} When I blow my whistle, I want each of you to kick off from the ground, hard. Keep your broom steady, hover for a moment, and then lean forward slightly and touch back down. On my whistle...3...2...{tweet!}
{Neville begins soaring away} M-M-Mr. Longbottom Mr. Longbottom!
Mr. Longbottom! {Neville approaches. The students scatter and Hooch dives out of the way. Neville goes through the scatter and up a tower.}
Everyone out of the way! {She runs through the group, and they scatter.} Come on, get up.

Oh, oh, oh, oh dear. It's a broken wrist. Tch, tch, tch. Good boy, come on now, up you get. {Draco reaches down and grabs Neville's Remembrall, which has fallen. Hooch begins to lead Neville away with her.} Everyone's to keep their feet firmly on the ground while I take Mr. Longbottom to the hospital wing. Understand? If I see a single broom in the air, the one riding it will find themselves out of Hogwarts before they can say, Quidditch. {Exit.}
Now, I want a nice clean game...from all of you. {looks at Slytherin. She kicks the trunk, and the bludgers zoom out.}

The flower petal had come from a lily. Your mother. The day I came downstairs, the day the bowl was empty, was the day your mother... I know why you're here, but I can't help you. It would ruin me.

[jumps up and grabs Ron's wand; aims the wand at Harry, then at Ron, then at Harry again] The adventure ends here, boys. But don't fret. [Points it at Ron] The world will know our story. Say goodbye... to your memories. Obliviate!
How fastidious you've become, Wormtail. As I recall, you once called the nearest gutter pipe home. Could it be the task of nursing me has become wearisome for you?
No! The boy is everything! It cannot be done without him. And it will be done exactly as I said.
Nagini tells me the old Muggle caretaker is standing just outside the door.
Step aside, Wormtail, so I can give our guest a proper greeting.

[The Death Eaters appear] Welcome, my friends. Thirteen years it's been, and yet, here you stand before me, as though it were only yesterday. I confess myself... disappointed. Not one of you tried to find me. [He unmasks the Death Eaters one by one and as he does they fall to their knees] Crabbe! Macnair! Goyle! Not even you, Lucius. [He pulls off Lucius' mask who falls to his knees]

Harry. I'd almost forgotten you were here. Standing on the bones of my father. I'd introduce you, but word has it you're almost as famous as me these days. The Boy-Who-Lived. How lies have fed your legend, Harry! Shall I reveal what really happened that night thirteen years ago? Shall I divulge how I truly lost my powers? Yes, shall I? It was love. You see, when dear, sweet Lily Potter gave her life for her only son, she provided the ultimate protection. I could not touch him. It was old magic. Something I should have foreseen. But no matter, no matter. Things have changed. I CAN TOUCH YOU NOW! [He places his finger on Harry's forehead lightning bolt scar, and Harry immediately screams out in agony, to Voldemort's cruel delight] Astonishing what a few drops of your blood will do, eh, Harry?

(as he roughly releases the scythe) Pick up your wand, Potter! I said, pick it up! Get up! Get up! (Harry gets his wand) You've been taught how to duel, I presume, yes? First, we bow to each other. (he bows, Harry does not) Come on now, Harry. The niceties must be observed. Dumbledore wouldn't want you to forget your manners, would he? I said, BOW! (uses a curse to make Harry bow) That's better, and now: Crucio! (Harry writhes on the grass in pain) Crucio! (the curse goes away) Attaboy, Harry! Your parents would be proud. Especially your filthy Muggle mother!

I'm going to kill you, Harry Potter. I'm going to destroy you. (leans down to meet Harry's eyes) After tonight, no one will ever again question my powers. After tonight, if they speak of you, they'll speak only of how you begged for death... and I, being a merciful Lord, obliged. Get up! (Harry groans)
(as he fires the Killing Curse at the tombstone; shouting) Don't you turn your back on me, Harry Potter! I want you to look at me when I kill you! I WANT TO SEE THE LIGHT LEAVE YOUR EYES!
[To the onlooking Death Eaters during Priori Incantatem] Do nothing! He's mine to finish!

Go and find Severus. Bring him to me.

The Elder Wand cannot serve me properly because I am not its true master. The Elder Wand belongs to the wizard who killed its last owner. You killed Dumbledore, Severus. Nagini, kill. [Nagini repeatedly bites Snape, mortally wounding him]
